questionSet.questionText: Which of the following is NOT a programming language?
In Java, when one wants to make a loop in a program, which is NOT a syntax for it?
What is the term used for declaring a integer? Type your answer like: 'string, double'
When naming variables, which of these is the correct way to name a variable with the value name of total student count?
In the following if statement, if (sum == 10), the == is called a ______ operator.
When writing a method, what is the variable between the parentheses called?
If you include a if statement, within another if statement, it's called an nested if statement. True or False?
Note the following array: [4, 16, 7, 54, 43, 87, 32], in what position does 7 belong to?
Which of the following is NOT a relational operator?

You are asked to write a program about student grades, you are required to loop through each student to see //
      how many students got an A for that course, but for this loop you have to loop through a specfic element type from the array //
      you are looping through, you think the way to do this is a for-each loop. Is this correct?

The following code has a missing space in it,
            int num = 4; //
              if (num _____ 7) //
              System.out.println('This number is less than 7); //
              What relational operator would best fit this statement?
If you wanted to make a final variable, meaning a variable that stays constant, the whole variable name must be capitalized. True or false?
A scanner with .nextInt() means that a user a enter what variable type?
Which of following methods would add an new element to an arraylist?
What is the method that initalizes the properties of an object within the object class called?
If you use the get method in an arraylist, what number should you put into the method to get the element from the 3rd position from the list?
If the compiler detects a error at a certain line, that means it detected a runtime error. True or False
If the loop condition is while ( testRun < runTotal) wuth testRun = 0 and runTotal = 5, how many times will this loop?
Which of the following is an acceptable value for a boolean variable?
Which is the correct way to call the addItem method that's from another class, use an object class call List as an example?

questionSet2.questionText: What is the HTML element used to display a paragraph?
To change the family of a text's font, what style attribute should you use to do this?
What is the HTML element used a section of an HTML page? Type your answer like: <tagname>?
If you wanted to add a style or a script onto an HTML page, the tags should in what HTML element? Type your answer like: <tagname>
If you want to include a checkbox using <form>, the input type you should use is radio. True or False?
